title: Ribeye and Egg Stir Fry
directions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Season the ribeye steak generously with salt and black pepper on both sides.
Heat vegetable oil in an oven-safe skillet over high heat.
Sear the ribeye steak for 2 minutes on each side to develop a crust.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and cook the steak for an additional 5-7 minutes for medium-rare.
While the steak is cooking, in a separate skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and chopped green onion to the skillet and sauté until fragrant and lightly golden.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk an egg with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Push the garlic and green onion mixture to one side of the skillet and pour the whisked egg into the other side.
Gently scramble the egg until cooked through, then mix it with the garlic and green onion.
Remove the steak from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
Serve the garlic butter ribeye topped with the scrambled egg, garlic, and green onion mixture.

title: Classic Margherita Pizza
directions: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, typically 475-500°F (245-260°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough.
Tear the mozzarella cheese and distribute it evenly over the sauce.
Drizzle a little olive oil and sprinkle a pinch of salt over the top.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes until the crust is golden and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from the oven and immediately add fresh basil leaves.
Slice and serve hot.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry Noodles
directions: Cook noodles according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the garlic and ginger, sauté for a minute until fragrant.
Add the carrots, bell pepper, and broccoli, stir-frying until vegetables are tender but crisp.
Toss in the cooked noodles and soy sauce, stir well to combine.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds.
